results.title: Osteogenic effects in a rat osteoporosis model and femur defect model by simvastatin microcrystals.
results.text_hl: Osteogenic effects in a @SPECIES_10116 @@@rat@@@ @DISEASE_Osteoporosis @DISEASE_MESH:D010024 @@@osteoporosis@@@ model and @<m>DISEASE_Femoral_Fractures_Distal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000092524 @@@femur defect@@@ model by @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ microcrystals.

citations.NLM: Zhu J, Zhang C, Jia J, Wang H, Leng H, Xu Y, Wu C, Zhang Q, Song C. Osteogenic effects in a rat osteoporosis model and femur defect model by simvastatin microcrystals. Ann N Y Acad Sci. 2021 Mar;1487(1):31-42. PMID: 33098131

results.title: Locally applied Simvastatin improves fracture healing in mice
results.text_hl: High doses of orally administered @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ has previously been shown to improve @DISEASE_Fractures_Bone @DISEASE_MESH:D050723 @@@fracture@@@ healing in a @SPECIES_10090 @@@mouse@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Femoral_Fractures_Distal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000092524 @@@femur fracture@@@ model.

citations.NLM: Skoglund B, Aspenberg P. Locally applied Simvastatin improves fracture healing in mice BMC Musculoskelet Disord. 2007 Sep 27;8():98. PMID: 17897477
citations.BibTeX: @article{17897477, title={Locally applied Simvastatin improves fracture healing in mice}, author={Skoglund B and Aspenberg P}, journal={BMC Musculoskelet Disord}, volume={8}, pages={98}}

results.title: The effects of locally applied simvastatin on an experimental mouse femur nonunion model.
results.text_hl: The effects of locally applied @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ on an experimental @SPECIES_10090 @@@mouse@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Femoral_Fractures_Distal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000092524 @@@femur nonunion@@@ model.

citations.NLM: Koçer A, Öner M, Karaman İ, Koçer D, Kafadar İH, Güney A, Karaman ZF. The effects of locally applied simvastatin on an experimental mouse femur nonunion model. Acta Orthop Traumatol Turc. 2014;48(6):679-84. PMID: 25637734
